<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// iteration if the output size still exceeds the limit. This function</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// In this default implementation, functions with fewest samples are dropped</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// first. Since the exact size of the output cannot be easily calculated due</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to compression, we use a heuristic to remove as many functions as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// necessary but not too many, aiming to minimize the number of write</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// iterations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Empirically, functions with larger total sample count contain linearly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// more sample entries, meaning it takes linearly more space to write them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The cumulative length is therefore quadratic if all functions are sorted</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// by total sample count.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// TODO: Find better heuristic.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sampleprof/defaultfunctionpruningstrategy/#a8abb143feff2f640ccc483ba91019c1b">Erase</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CurrentOutputSize) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">override</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Set the profile to be partial. It means the profile is for</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::error&#95;code compressAndOutput();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We will swap the raw&#95;ostream held by LocalBufStream and that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// held by OutputStream if we try to add a section which needs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// compression. After the swap, all the data written to output</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// will be temporarily buffered into the underlying raw&#95;string&#95;ostream</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// originally held by LocalBufStream. After the data writing for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// section is completed, compress the data in the local buffer,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// swap the raw&#95;ostream back and write the compressed data to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// real output.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;raw&#95;ostream&gt; LocalBufStream;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The location where the output stream starts.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint64&#95;t FileStart;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The location in the output stream where the SecHdrTable should be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// written to.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint64&#95;t SecHdrTableOffset;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The table contains SecHdrTableEntry entries in order of how they are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// populated in the writer. It may be different from the order in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SectionHdrLayout which specifies the sequence in which sections will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be read.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;SecHdrTableEntry&gt; SecHdrTable;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FuncOffsetTable maps function context to its profile offset in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SecLBRProfile section. It is used to load function profile on demand.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mapvector">MapVector&lt;SampleContext, uint64&#95;t&gt;</a> FuncOffsetTable;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Whether to use MD5 to represent string.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> UseMD5 = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CSNameTable maps function context to its offset in SecCSNameTable section.</span></CodeLine>
